content: @StPaulTim I'm in central time. I've done this a few times where everyone gets set up in the game and then in parallel in a video call. So you can play the game but aren't restricted to text chat. You can actually have a conversation on one layer and game play on another, with some overlap periodically.

If (like me) you already dislike the name "Settlers of Catan" you'll have to grit your teeth extra hard at the name of this knockoff online version: https://colonist.io

Colonist: Play Settlers of Catan Alternative - Free Online Game
Online board game alternative to the popular game Settlers of Catan and PlayCatan. Colonist allows you to play now without the need to download or sign in.

At work we do some online boardgames twice a month. Since we're all virtual it's one of our only interactions outside of work. We use Boardgame Arena, which has become quite popular these last few weeks
I'd be up for a game if the stars align

@Herb - Your responsible for taking me away from Backdrop the last 48 hours. I didn't need to know about Boardgame Arena.

:-)

Thanks to @Herb :-), I've made some new gaming friends on BoardGameArena that also happen to live in the Twin Cities. Tonight, we had a combination Zoom / Board Game Arena session and played 7 Wonders and Sushi Go. It went pretty well.

I think we should try it, sometime soon.
We may need to do a mid day session sometime soon, so that our friends in Europe can participate. If they are interested.
